message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how to identify and build the figure shown:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  Analysis of the Main Target Image
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  TOTAL BLOCKS & LAYERS  
  – There are 6 total blocks forming 3 “layers.”  
  – Bottom Layer: An upright orange cylinder at center with two orange triangular wedges flanking it.  
  – Middle Layer: A single red “C‐shaped” (or “U‐shaped”) block that fits over the cylinder from the front.  
  – Top Layer: Two yellow half‐cylinders set side‐by‐side on top.  

•  SPATIAL RELATIONSHIPS  
  – The orange cylinder (vertical) is the core of the structure, with each orange triangular wedge placed against the cylinder at its base, one on the left side and one on the right side.  
  – Above the cylinder sits one large red block that has a vertical half‐cylindrical cutout facing the front, so it can “wrap” around the cylinder.  
  – Finally, two identical yellow half‐cylinders sit horizontally on top of that red block.  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  Selecting the Required Blocks From the Dictionary
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
To match color, shape, and especially orientation (since no further rotation is allowed), the following pieces from the dictionary are used:

 •  Orange Cylinder → Block #8  
    (the tall, vertical orange cylinder)  
 •  Orange Triangular Wedges → Blocks #14 and #15  
    (one wedge for the left side at the base and the other wedge, mirrored, for the right side)  
 •  Red “C‐Shaped” Block → Block #7  
    (the red rectangular prism with a half‐cylindrical hole facing front)  
 •  Yellow Half‐Cylinders → Two copies of Block #10  
    (each half‐cylindrical piece has its flat face down and curved top up)

Hence the final list of needed indices is:
[ 8, 14, 15, 7, 10, 10 ]  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  Step‐by‐Step Assembly Order
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{  
  Step1: Move block with index 8  
  Step2: Move block with index 14  
  Step3: Move block with index 15  
  Step4: Move block with index 7  
  Step5: Move block with index 10  
  Step6: Move block with index 10  
}

A good way to think of the build is:  
• Place the tall orange cylinder (#8) upright.  
• Put the two triangular wedges (#14 and #15) around its base.  
• Slide on the red “C‐shaped” block (#7) over the top portion.  
• Finish by placing the two yellow half‐cylinders (#10 and #10) side by side along the top.
